q: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
h:
“The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.
h:
“Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.” —
Tony Robbins

q: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
h:
“It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Freedom lies in being bold.
h:
“Freedom lies in being bold.” —
Robert Frost

q: To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.
h:
“To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
h:
“You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.
h:
“Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless, like water.
h:
“Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless, like water.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Your business is not to 'get somewhere' - it is to be here.
h:
“Your business is not to 'get somewhere' - it is to be here.” —
Dan Millman

q: It is in the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has.
h:
“It is in the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
h:
“Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.” —
Alexander Pope

q: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.
h:
“I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
h:
“The energy of the mind is the essence of life.” —
Aristotle

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:
“Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.” —
Mark Twain

q: Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
h:
“Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.” —
Voltaire

q: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
h:
“The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.” —
William Faulkner

q: Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.
h:
“Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: We must cultivate our garden.
h:
“We must cultivate our garden. ” —
Voltaire

q: Ripe fruit falls by itself - but it doesn't fall in your mouth.
h:
“Ripe fruit falls by itself - but it doesn't fall in your mouth. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
h:
“Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.” —
John Wooden

q: Love is the absence of judgment.
h:
“Love is the absence of judgment.” —
Dalai Lama

q: We have to live life with a sense of urgency so not a minute is wasted.
h:
“We have to live life with a sense of urgency so not a minute is wasted.” —
Les Brown

q: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.
h:
“Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: The less you respond to negative people, the more positive your life will become.
h:
“The less you respond to negative people, the more positive your life will become.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.
h:
“Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:
“A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
h:
“The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
h:
“Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.” —
Les Brown

q: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
h:
“If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
h:
“Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.” —
Socrates

q: To do two things at once is to do neither.
h:
“To do two things at once is to do neither.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.
h:
“Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.
h:
“As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.” —
James Allen

q: Sometimes you put walls up not to keep people out, but to see who cares enough to break them down.
h:
“Sometimes you put walls up not to keep people out, but to see who cares enough to break them down.” —
Socrates

q: For things to change, you have to change.
h:
“For things to change, you have to change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.
h:
“Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.” —
Seneca

q: We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.
h:
“We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.
h:
“You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them.
h:
“We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them. ” —
Seneca

q: By seeking and blundering we learn.
h:
“By seeking and blundering we learn.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: To live outside the law, you must be honest.
h:
“To live outside the law, you must be honest. ” —
Bob Dylan

q: Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech.
h:
“Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech. ” —
Albert Einstein

q: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.
h:
“Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on.
h:
“Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
h:
“I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
h:
“We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.” —
Sydney Smith

q: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
h:
“If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.” —
Henry Ford

q: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
h:
“Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.
h:
“Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Make your stand today. On this spot. On this day.
h:
“Make your stand today. On this spot. On this day.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
h:
“Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.” —
George Eliot

q: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
h:
“Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.” —
Lao Tzu

q: What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.
h:
“What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.” —
Robert Greene

q: Don't let the noise of others opinions drown out your inner voice.
h:
“Don't let the noise of others opinions drown out your inner voice.” —
Steve Jobs

q: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
h:
“The best way to predict your future is to create it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
h:
“Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.” —
Mark Twain

q: Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.
h:
“Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.” —
Robert Greene

q: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
h:
“Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!” —
Alfred Adler

q: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
h:
“Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.” —
Jim Rohn

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: What keeps life fascinating is the constant creativity of the soul.
h:
“What keeps life fascinating is the constant creativity of the soul.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.
h:
“Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.” —
Bob Marley

q: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
h:
“Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.” —
Mother Teresa

q: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
h:
“If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.” —
Thomas Edison

q: If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup.
h:
“If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
h:
“Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.” —
George Eliot

q: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
h:
“Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.” —
Jim Rohn

q: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
h:
“You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.” —
Mae West

q: This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
h:
“This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.” —
Alan Watts

q: Growth comes at the point of resistance.
h:
“Growth comes at the point of resistance.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Your past does not equal your future.
h:
“Your past does not equal your future.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Use your smile to change the world but don't let the world change your smile.
h:
“Use your smile to change the world but don't let the world change your smile.” —
Unknown

q: You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills.
h:
“You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills.” —
Jim Rohn

q: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
h:
“It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Watch what you say, and whatever you say, practice it.
h:
“Watch what you say, and whatever you say, practice it.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.
h:
“There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.
h:
“All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.” —
Samuel Butler

q: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
h:
“I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Courage is found in unlikely places.
h:
“Courage is found in unlikely places.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.
h:
“Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
h:
“Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.” —
Osho

q: Youth has no age.
h:
“Youth has no age.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.
h:
“If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.” —
Robert Greene

q: Any thought that is passed on to the subconscious often enough and convincingly enough is finally accepted.
h:
“Any thought that is passed on to the subconscious often enough and convincingly enough is finally accepted.” —
Robert Collier

q: Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.
h:
“Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
h:
“Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
h:
“Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.” —
Elon Musk

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
h:
“Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen King

q: If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.
h:
“If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
h:
“Either you run the day or the day runs you.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Storms don't last forever.
h:
“Storms don't last forever.” —
Unknown

q: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
h:
“The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
h:
“The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.
h:
“To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.” —
Isaac Newton

q: Walk with those seeking truth... RUN FROM THOSE WHO THINK THEY'VE FOUND IT.
h:
“Walk with those seeking truth... RUN FROM THOSE WHO THINK THEY'VE FOUND IT.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
h:
“Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.
h:
“If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.” —
Robert Kiyosaki
